meanings.definition: To hire or engage the services of someone for a job or task.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to employ a new accountant to manage their finances.
meanings.sent2: She chose to employ a professional painter to redo her living room.
meanings.sent3: The circus decided to employ a clown who could juggle while riding a unicycle.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, each piece is employed strategically to protect the king.
meanings.sent5: To succeed in the mission, they must employ all their skills and teamwork.

meanings.definition: To make use of or utilize something.
meanings.sent1: He likes to employ his creativity when solving problems.
meanings.sent2: The chef will employ fresh herbs to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to employ a magnifying glass to search for clues.
meanings.sent4: She will employ her charm to convince him to attend the party.
meanings.sent5: To build the model airplane, you need to employ the instructions carefully.

meanings.sent1: During the summer break, she will employ herself by learning a new skill.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will employ various activities to engage the students in the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The cat will employ its hunting instincts to catch the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The artist will employ different colors to create a vibrant painting.
meanings.sent5: To relax, he will employ meditation techniques to calm his mind.
